channel.title: RS Worldmap Applet
channel.description: Ok, so here's the thing... I was wondering if anyone could write a proggy to extract the world map image from the actual applet as it isn't blurry like the one you can download... After examining the situation I've come to the conclusion that the map is mostlikely stored in a resource file in the rsmap cache so maybe that might complicate things, unless you would be able to deob the map and make it dump the image...

item.title: RS Worldmap Applet
item.dc:creator: @RancidKraut RancidKraut
item.description:
@RancidKraut wrote:

Nick Stallman (Cheater from RuneCMS) did it. And like always, he used it to make money: http://www.runescape-map.org/

He claims that his images are “better than RS quality.” I don’t know if he means better than the image you can download (which they obviously are), or better than the actual client minimap. He hasn’t released his actual applet, but those images on that site are dynamic (and cached).

Read full topic

item.title: RS Worldmap Applet
item.dc:creator: @Freddy1990 Freddy1990
item.description:
@Freddy1990 wrote:

Well, I’ve got something that might interest all of you

[QUOTE=semaphore]Rudimentary.

Threw this together. Thanks to joujoujou for the export to png functionality.

Usage:

It’s a jar file so change the extension. (For those of you that are complete morons.)

Usage:

java [Options]* -Xms128m -Xmx256m -jar rsmap.jar

*Note the jvm heap settings. If you don’t want it to crash while 'e’xporting, I suggest you follow my instructions else you figure out how to deal with your own OutOfMemoryError…
**Note the file it pukes out is ~27meg… how efficient.

Options:

-DW=width - width of the mapplet - int (635)
-DH=height - height of the mapplet - int (503)
-Dtext=(on|true|[1-9]+|yes|off|false|0|no) - toggle text printing on the mapplet
-Dbuttons=(on|true|[1-9]+|yes|off|false|0|no) - toggle buttons displaying on the mapplet
-Dicons=(on|true|[1-9]+|yes|off|false|0|no) - toggle icons displaying on the mapplet

Defaults are in bold. I’ve taken care of the few translations where they hardcoded the map size to 635x503 so have fun. I’ve tested at 635x503, 800x600, 1024x768, 1280x1024, and 1600x1200.

While in game here are some key shortcuts:

arrow keys - umm… they buy you a chainsaw.
k - toggle showing the Key
o - toggle showing the overview
1 - 37% zoom
2 - 50% zoom
3 - 75% zoom
4 - 100% zoom
e - export the map (i didn’t research this much)
i - toggles the icons
b - toggles the buttons
t - toggles the text

Have fun kids. By the way, the source is included in the zip.

edit: Duh’s on the source.

edit: I’m also going to add a relative and absolute location display in the top of the screen to show precisely what location your mouse is hovering over. (Maybe even coords for stupid trails)

edit: Added a few features: b, i, t toggling along with moving the buttons according to the size of the mapplet.[/quote]

I also added joujoujou’s original Applet_Sub1_Sub1 file which allows to export the image.

Read full topic

item.title: RS Worldmap Applet
item.dc:creator: @Bebemycat2 Bebe
item.description:
@Bebemycat2 wrote:

[quote=“Freddy1990, post:1, topic:108756”]Ok, so here’s the thing…
I was wondering if anyone could write a proggy to extract the world map image from the actual applet as it isn’t blurry like the one you can download…
After examining the situation I’ve come to the conclusion that the map is mostlikely stored in a resource file in the rsmap cache so maybe that might complicate things, unless you would be able to deob the map and make it dump the image…[/quote]
So you want a program that dumps the RS map image(s)?

RLN:

It’s possible, but why bother?

For one, SRL could update it’s MM symbols without having to walk all through RS and collect them by hand. (I know, I did it, and it sucked :()

Read full topic
